medical_history.chief_complaint: A 13-year-old male presented with right hip pain, fever, rigors, night sweats, weight loss, and intermittent chest pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2-3 months prior to evaluation, with a gradual increase in severity.
medical_history.family_history: Family history revealed disseminated mycobacterial infections in the patient's father and uncle, starting at 9 years old and 1 year old, respectively.
